content:
• Thursday, May 31, 2012

  • S&P futures tumble, -0.6% following the weak China PMI print. The euro extends its bear run,...

    S&P futures tumble, -0.6% following the weak China PMI print. The euro extends its bear run, -0.3% to $1.2330. Hardest hit are the aussie, -0.7% to $0.9668, and Australian shares, -1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 PM | 8 Comments
  • UBNT

    Volatile, heavily-shorted Ubiquiti Networks (UBNT +9.5%) surged to $18.65 after Wunderlich...

    Volatile, heavily-shorted Ubiquiti Networks (UBNT +9.5%) surged to $18.65 after Wunderlich upgraded shares to Buy, albeit while maintaining a PT of just $18. The upgrade, which comes less than a month after a downgrade, is mostly valuation-related, and Wunderlich adds it still thinks near-term EPS upside is limited due to the investments Ubiquiti needs to make in its airFiber solution and three other platforms. Ubiquiti is down 4% in AH trading to $17.90.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM | 3 Comments
  • OVTI

    More on OmniVision's FQ4: Gross margin fell 170 bps Q/Q and 820 bps Y/Y to 22.5%, and...

    More on OmniVision's FQ4: Gross margin fell 170 bps Q/Q and 820 bps Y/Y to 22.5%, and contributed to the EPS miss. The company blames one-time inventory issues. However, it's also guiding for FQ1 revenue of $235M-$255M and EPS of $0.16-$0.27; the former is above a $219.2M consensus, but the latter is below a Street estimate of $0.29. Did Apple obtain favorable pricing for its iPad and (assuming rumors are true) iPhone image sensor orders? OVTI -3.9% AH. (PR) (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • OVTI

    OmniVision Technologies (NASDAQ:OVTI): FQ4 EPS of $0.20 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $218.5M...

    OmniVision Technologies (NASDAQ:OVTI): FQ4 EPS of $0.20 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $218.5M (-15.4% Y/Y) beats by $13M. Shares -5.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB +5.1%) rallied in afternoon trading, and closed at $29.63. Topeka Capital's bullish...

    Facebook (FB +5.1%) rallied in afternoon trading, and closed at $29.63. Topeka Capital's bullish call echoes a common argument among Facebook bulls: that the company will ultimately justify its lofty valuation by finding ways to leverage its giant user base and volumes of data to open up major untapped revenue streams. Those streams, in Topeka's view, include e-commerce, online payments, search ads, and classifieds, and are collectively worth over $1T.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 15 Comments
  • VRA

    Viragen (NASDAQ:VRA): Q1 EPS of $0.31 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $117.2M (+15.6% Y/Y) beats by...

    Viragen (NASDAQ:VRA): Q1 EPS of $0.31 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $117.2M (+15.6% Y/Y) beats by $1M. Shares +8.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • RLD

    RealD (NYSE:RLD): FQ4 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.18. Revenue of $50M (-14.5% Y/Y) beats by $3M....

    RealD (NYSE:RLD): FQ4 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.18. Revenue of $50M (-14.5% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Shares +4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • FLO

    Flowers Foods (FLO +5.3%) gets an added boost from an upgrade to Buy at SunTrust. The firm...

    Flowers Foods (FLO +5.3%) gets an added boost from an upgrade to Buy at SunTrust. The firm expects FLO to benefit from accelerating organic growth and and a more rational market from the Sara Lee/Bimbo merger.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM
  • JOY

    Despite an order slowdown in the latest quarter, Joy Global (JOY -5.7%) CEO Mike Sutherlin...

    Despite an order slowdown in the latest quarter, Joy Global (JOY -5.7%) CEO Mike Sutherlin remains upbeat on global demand for mining equipment from overseas, including China. He says that while some planned projects may be pushed back because of broad economic uncertainty, producers were moving ahead with existing expansion.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • FRX

    Forest Labs (FRX +3.5%) gains on an upgrade to Outperform at Leerink, citing the blockbuster...

    Forest Labs (FRX +3.5%) gains on an upgrade to Outperform at Leerink, citing the blockbuster potential of the company's aclidinium franchise, sales growth expectations from new product launches and its attractive potential as a takeover candidate. The firm also raises its price target to $41 from $33 - $34.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM
  • QRVO

    RF Micro Devices (RFMD +2%) rebounds a little from yesterday's selloff after Barclays says it...

    RF Micro Devices (RFMD +2%) rebounds a little from yesterday's selloff after Barclays says it believes the chipmaker secured "additional antenna content" in the next-gen iPhone. The firm also believes Apple is making additional use of film bulk acoustic resonators (FBARs), which it considers a positive for Avago (AVGO +0.1%). In-line with expectations, existing iPhone suppliers Skyworks (SWKS +2.7%) and TriQuint (TQNT -2.1%) are also believed to have secured design wins.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • OVTI

    OmniVision (OVTI +7.1%) is rallying ahead of this afternoon's FQ4 report, thanks to an upgrade...

    OmniVision (OVTI +7.1%) is rallying ahead of this afternoon's FQ4 report, thanks to an upgrade to Overweight from JPMorgan. The firm thinks OmniVision's risk-reward is favorable following its recent selloff, and it has become more optimistic the company will win back iPhone image sensor share with the launch of the next iPhone. A recent Digitimes report said OmniVision is "believed to have secured" new iPhone and iPad design wins.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • YELP

    Yelp (YELP -3.7%) is joining in on a general selloff in high-beta Internet and social networking...

    Yelp (YELP -3.7%) is joining in on a general selloff in high-beta Internet and social networking names; shares are now down 25% since the day of Facebook's IPO, and are closing in on the company's IPO price of $15. Google's (NASDAQ:GOOG) recent overhaul of its local commerce content, which includes the arrival of free Zagat reviews, could also be weighing on shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • TSM

    Chip foundries TSMC (TSM -0.4%) and UMC (UMC -3.1%) get downgraded to Hold and Sell,...

    Chip foundries TSMC (TSM -0.4%) and UMC (UMC -3.1%) get downgraded to Hold and Sell, respectively, by Goldman's Donald Lu, who's worried about customer inventories. Lu point out TSMC and UMC's customers saw their inventories grow 3% Q/Q in Q1, and believes the gap between the foundries' strong guidance and the softer guidance of its customers suggests inventories will grow further in Q2. Moreover, macro issues and weak PC/industrial demand stand to limit 2H chip sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • END

    Shares of Endeavour (END +72%) skyrocket after the oil and gas company says it completed the...

    Shares of Endeavour (END +72%) skyrocket after the oil and gas company says it completed the acquisition of the additional 23.43% working interest in the Alba field in the North Sea from ConocoPhillips (NYSE:COP). As a result, net proceeds from the 2018 notes offering have been released from escrow.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • RCM

    The worst has past for Accretive Health (AH +2.5%), says Oppenheimer. The firm says that after...

    The worst has past for Accretive Health (AH +2.5%), says Oppenheimer. The firm says that after attending Senator Franken's hearing on the charges against the company, it's confident that the more egregious charges are baseless. The firm thinks that the lack of new evidence indicates that the worst headline risk has passed.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • OLED

    Universal Display (PANL -2.9%) is trading lower, albeit off its lows for the day, after Wedbush...

    Universal Display (PANL -2.9%) is trading lower, albeit off its lows for the day, after Wedbush started coverage with a Neutral and $32 PT. The firm believes consensus estimates for PANL are optimistic, even if the company will benefit from strong growth in OLED panel production. Yesterday, Herb Greenberg questioned the timing of PANL's May 17 disclosure of adverse Japanese patent rulings, given the company was originally notified on May 10.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • MVIS

    Microvision (MVIS +43.4%) soars after receiving a $4M order from Pioneer to supply components...

    Microvision (MVIS +43.4%) soars after receiving a $4M order from Pioneer to supply components related to its HD PicoP laser-based display technology, which will be used by Pioneer in car navigation systems. Microvision, which has long sought to commercialize technology similar to what Google has developed for Project Glass, will also collect royalties from Pioneer, according to the terms of an April agreement.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • CHTP

    Wedbush says the selloff in Chelsea Therapeutics (CHTP -32%) today has been overdone, and...

    Wedbush says the selloff in Chelsea Therapeutics (CHTP -32%) today has been overdone, and reiterates its Outperform rating on the stock. The shares have been hit hard after the company announced that CH-4051 failed in its Phase 2 trial versus methotrexate. However, the firm thinks that the results weren't as bad as originally thought, and the drug developer can run another Phase 2 trial in the future. It also adds that Northera remains the main driver for the company at present.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • BMRN

    BioMarin's (BMRN -7.2%) recent secondary offers a buying opportunity ahead of the company's...

    BioMarin's (BMRN -7.2%) recent secondary offers a buying opportunity ahead of the company's trial data releases, says Citigroup. Citi notes management comments stating that the financing is not intended to support any acquisitions in the near-term, which will give the company a cleaner balance sheet and leave its pipeline potentially well funded.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM
  • MLCO

    Wells Fargo's Cameron McKnight advises investors to buy the dip in Melco Crown (MPEL -3.1%) on...

    Wells Fargo's Cameron McKnight advises investors to buy the dip in Melco Crown (MPEL -3.1%) on his take the stock's reaction to the news MPEL co-chairman James Packer could face a suitability test from Australian regulators is overdone. Shares of MPEL are well off their intra-day lows, but still lag peers.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM
  • TRN

    Susquehanna says Trinity Industries (TRN -2.5%) recent sell-off is overdone , citing the...

    Susquehanna says Trinity Industries (TRN -2.5%) recent sell-off is overdone , citing the company's order stability and a solid backlog. The firm also believes the company is poised for better revenues, driven by higher pricing, a better product mix and improvements in production efficiency.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) -6.3% after BofA cuts its 2012 earnings forecast for the company, citing...

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) -6.3% after BofA cuts its 2012 earnings forecast for the company, citing fears about U.S. streaming growth and the costs related to its international expansion.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM | 4 Comments

  • As WTI crude continues its protracted descent, now -1.4% to $86.55/bbl, oil is now officially in...

    As WTI crude continues its protracted descent, now -1.4% to $86.55/bbl, oil is now officially in bear territory, BMO's Sal Guatieri says. Deutsche Bank also joins the sliding sentiment, as "physical fundamentals are also weakening with crude oil inventories on the rise." How low can oil go? "Following the 2008 credit crisis and global downturn, it bottomed at $31,” Guatieri recalls.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM | 12 Comments
  • DTG

    Dollar Thrifty (DTG +1.8%) and Hertz (HTZ -1.7%) move in different directions after CNBC airs a...

    Dollar Thrifty (DTG +1.8%) and Hertz (HTZ -1.7%) move in different directions after CNBC airs a report that a deal between the two companies isn't imminent.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • ELN

    Elan (ELN -3.1%) slips on a downgrade to Neutral on valuation at UBS, noting that Bapineuzumab's...

    Elan (ELN -3.1%) slips on a downgrade to Neutral on valuation at UBS, noting that Bapineuzumab's economic potential may be lower than expected.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 2 Comments
  • FFIV

    As F5 (FFIV -6.8%) tumbles on news of sales chief Mark Anderson's resignation, UBS is slashing...

    As F5 (FFIV -6.8%) tumbles on news of sales chief Mark Anderson's resignation, UBS is slashing its estimates due to concerns about weak Euro demand. The firm notes EMEA accounts for ~20% of F5's sales, and recent downbeat comments from Cisco and Infoblox lead it to estimate F5's June quarter sales to the region will fall 5% Q/Q (other markets are expected to grow 5%). Piper aired similar commentary yesterday about rival Riverbed's (NASDAQ:RVBD) Euro exposure.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • SRCI

    Synergy Resources (SYRG +1.5%) is one of today's very few gainers among energy and natural...

    Synergy Resources (SYRG +1.5%) is one of today's very few gainers among energy and natural resource stocks, as the oil and gas operator reports strong initial production rates from its first horizontal well.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB -3.4%) can't catch a break. Shares are making new lows today even though Pivotal...

    Facebook (FB -3.4%) can't catch a break. Shares are making new lows today even though Pivotal Research is upgrading shares to Hold on valuation grounds, and Topeka Capital is starting coverage at Buy. Shares are now down 29% from their $38 IPO price. Yesterday, Kleiner Perkins VC Mary Meeker (previous) defended the company, but added Kleiner didn't make a single investment in a $1B fund in Q1 because "the private market is a bubble."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM | 5 Comments
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -4.4%) trades lower as court filings unveiled show that the...

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -4.4%) trades lower as court filings unveiled show that the SEC's probe of the company isn't finished yet. How the company recognizes revenue is still on the radar of the agency, according to hearing transcripts.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM | 3 Comments
  • CLF

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -6.7%) is cut to Neutral from Buy at BofA Merrill, which also...

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -6.7%) is cut to Neutral from Buy at BofA Merrill, which also lowers its price target to $60 from $84 with a more cautious outlook on iron ore. The firm is confident in CLF’s ability to lower costs and add capacity, but weakening iron ore prices trump these accomplishments; sustained cash flow strength and a 5% dividend yield may be at risk.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • JWN

    Nordstrom's (JWN -4.1%) trades lower despite reporting better-than-forecast same-store sales for...

    Nordstrom's (JWN -4.1%) trades lower despite reporting better-than-forecast same-store sales for May. Analysts aren't keen on the company's excuses on clearance inventory and lack of guidance, as they also point to soft channel checks as an overhang.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • SLB

    Major oil services stocks (OIH -3.1%) are hammered in early trading, capping a brutal May as...

    Major oil services stocks (OIH -3.1%) are hammered in early trading, capping a brutal May as crude oil prices declined and equities reeled in the face of the European debt crisis and slowing global growth. SLB -3.8%, WFT -4.5%, HAL -2.9%, BHI -2.5%, RIG -2.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA +3.4%) bounces a little after Baird's Colin Sebastian upgrades shares Outperform due...

    Zynga (ZNGA +3.4%) bounces a little after Baird's Colin Sebastian upgrades shares Outperform due to its lower valuation and an upcoming game refresh. He adds Facebook's (NASDAQ:FB) growing focus on mobile devices should bolster Zynga's own mobile position, and says his checks indicate other developers are "shifting focus away from Facebook," partly due to Zynga's "most favored nation" status. The latter assertion is surprising, given the tough competition Zynga has recently faced.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM | 3 Comments
  • JOY

    Farm and construction machinery company Joy Global (NYSE:JOY) -6.1% after it cuts its outlook...

    Farm and construction machinery company Joy Global (NYSE:JOY) -6.1% after it cuts its outlook due to eroding trends in Europe and China, and is possibly taking down Caterpillar (CAT -3.9%) with it.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • BOCX

    Microcap BioCurex (OTC:BOCX) surges 150% after saying that it's received a commitment from...

    Microcap BioCurex (OTC:BOCX) surges 150% after saying that it's received a commitment from Paulson Investment to make an investment in a long-term convertible note. BioCurex will use the money to pay off a short-term debt obligation that's due in a couple of weeks. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • BKE

    Shares of Buckle (BKE -7.1%) slump after the company's report on same-store sale for May...

    Shares of Buckle (BKE -7.1%) slump after the company's report on same-store sale for May underwhelms. The retailer may have suffered from a trend of more American consumers preferring to bargain shop (think TJX) over loading up on trendier clothing at higher prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • AEZS

    Aeterna Zentaris (NASDAQ:AEZS) +7.6%, with the main news being the publication of an article...

    Aeterna Zentaris (NASDAQ:AEZS) +7.6%, with the main news being the publication of an article describing how the firm's perifosine compound could be used to treat Malignant Pleural Mesothelioma, an aggressive cancer associated with exposure to asbestos. Shares were hit in April after the failure of a Phase III trial for colorectal cancer. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM | 5 Comments
  • MLCO

    Casino stocks open weak across the board, led lower by Melco Crown (MPEL -6.7%) and MGM Resorts...

    Casino stocks open weak across the board, led lower by Melco Crown (MPEL -6.7%) and MGM Resorts (MGM -4.4%). Enthusiasm has been dented by slumping stock markets in Asia, with a large part of the thesis for growth in the sector tied to a boom in Asian operations.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • LGF.A

    Execs with Lions Gate (LGF +1.3%) say on a CC that 90% of the profit for The Hunger Games still...

    Execs with Lions Gate (LGF +1.3%) say on a CC that 90% of the profit for The Hunger Games still lies ahead for the company. Shares of LGF have started to move up during the course of the call after sitting in negative territory premarket. (webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM | 3 Comments
  • SNCR

    Synchronoss (SNCR +3.1%), which made new 52-week lows yesterday, jumps out of the gate after...

    Synchronoss (SNCR +3.1%), which made new 52-week lows yesterday, jumps out of the gate after JPMorgan upgrades shares to Overweight on valuation grounds. The firm notes shares had fallen 39% since the company's issued weak guidance to go with its Q1 report, and praises the company's growth prospects with AT&T and Verizon, as well as its potential to add new carrier customers.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM
  • CDTI

    Clean Diesel Technolgies (OTC:CDTI +22.3%) pops at the open on news it received an expanded...

    Clean Diesel Technolgies (OTC:CDTI +22.3%) pops at the open on news it received an expanded verification from the EPA for its ECS-branded Purifilter Plus diesel particulate filter emission reduction system.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE) -16.7% after filing an 8-K in which it claims its history of losses and cash...

    A123 Systems (AONE) -16.7% after filing an 8-K in which it claims its history of losses and cash burn "raise substantial doubt on the Company's ability to continue as a going concern." It's added management is trying to raise cash and is "evaluating other strategic alternatives," and is "in discussions with strategic partners for substantial investments." A123 had $113M in cash and equivalents as of March 31, down from $187M three months earlier.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM | 2 Comments
  • ISR

    IsoRay (NYSEMKT:ISR) shares, +6.4% premarket, could add to 85% gains of the past week, sparked...

    IsoRay (NYSEMKT:ISR) shares, +6.4% premarket, could add to 85% gains of the past week, sparked by news the Discovery Channel featured ISR's Cesium-131 internal radiation therapy treatment for localized prostate cancer, and its GliaSite radiation therapy system was approved for sale in 31 European countries.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM

  • Market preview: And it was all going so well. EU shares and U.S. stock futures were humming...

    Market preview: And it was all going so well. EU shares and U.S. stock futures were humming along nicely, helped by falling German unemployment, until disappointing U.S. jobless claims and ADP data sent markets tumbling. The S&P benchmark is +0.2%. LionsGate is -4% following its FQ4 loss, while Kohl's is -4.3% after May same-store sales. Later: Chicago PMI
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • T

    Prepaid carrier Leap Wireless (LEAP) +4.9% after stating it will begin selling the iPhone...

    Prepaid carrier Leap Wireless (LEAP) +4.9% after stating it will begin selling the iPhone (NASDAQ:AAPL) on June 22, in tandem with a $55/month unlimited voice/text/data plan. Since the device will be offered without contract, Leap's subsidies are much lower: the 16GB iPhone 4S will sell for $500, while the 8GB iPhone 4 will go for $400. Leap is coming off a rough Q1 in which it lost share to nationwide rivals. The news comes shortly after several regional U.S. carriers began offering the iPhone.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM
  • EROC

    Eagle Rock Energy (NASDAQ:EROC) -3.7% premarket after announcing the launch of an at-the-market...

    Eagle Rock Energy (NASDAQ:EROC) -3.7% premarket after announcing the launch of an at-the-market equity program of up to $100M, with net proceeds directed toward general partnership purposes such as debt repayment, acquisitions, capital expenditures and additions to working capital.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM | 1 Comment
  • TLB

    Premarket gainers: TLB +100%. MVIS +27%. GET +12%. ISR +7%. CIEN +5%. Losers: CHTP -23%. AONE...

    Premarket gainers: TLB +100%. MVIS +27%. GET +12%. ISR +7%. CIEN +5%.
    Losers: CHTP -23%. AONE -19%. JOY -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • CIEN

    More on Ciena's FQ2: The company expects FQ3 revenue of $455M-$485M, in-line with a $471.1M...

    More on Ciena's FQ2: The company expects FQ3 revenue of $455M-$485M, in-line with a $471.1M consensus. In spite of revenue increase, FQ2 gross margin fell 170 bps Y/Y to 39.6%. Optical transmission gear made up 2/3 of revenue, whereas optical switches and carrier Ethernet switches each made up less than 7%. With 29% of Ciena's float shorted as of May 15, and shares down sharply in recent weeks, a short squeeze could occur. CIEN +5.2%. JDSU +1.5%. FNSR +1.4%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • CHTP

    Chelsea Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CHTP) -24.1% premarket after announcing a clinical study of its...

    Chelsea Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CHTP) -24.1% premarket after announcing a clinical study of its investigational rheumatoid arthritis treatment CH-4051 missed a primary endpoint, and the drug maker says it has no further plans to develop the medication.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM
  • MAR

    Marriott International (NYSE:MAR) acquires the Gaylord Hotels brand from Gaylord Entertainment...

    Marriott International (NYSE:MAR) acquires the Gaylord Hotels brand from Gaylord Entertainment (GET) for $210M. The deal will add 4 hotels with close to 7.8K rooms to Marriott's portfolio. GET +13.3% premarket, MAR inactive.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM
  • KSS

    Shares of Kohl's (NYSE:KSS) lose 4.6% in premarket trading after the company reports...

    Shares of Kohl's (NYSE:KSS) lose 4.6% in premarket trading after the company reports worse-than-expected May same-store sales as a discussed bounce from disgruntled J.C. Penney shoppers didn't quite register. The company says it made progress building inventory levels, but warns that it expects lower units to dampen sales until the Back-to-School season.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:53 AM | 1 Comment
  • TJX

    Shares of TJX Companies (NYSE:TJX) move up 1.1% premarket after the company beats estimates with...

    Shares of TJX Companies (NYSE:TJX) move up 1.1% premarket after the company beats estimates with its report on May same-store sales and says on a CC that it sees Q2 EPS coming in on the high end of its previously announced range.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM | 1 Comment
  • KSS

    Kohl's (NYSE:KSS) same-store sales: -4.2% misses consensus of -1.2%. Shares -4.7% premarket. (PR)

    Kohl's (NYSE:KSS) same-store sales: -4.2% misses consensus of -1.2%. Shares -4.7% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM | 1 Comment
  • TGT

    Shares of Target (NYSE:TGT) move up 1.7% premarket after the company beats the forecast of...

    Shares of Target (NYSE:TGT) move up 1.7% premarket after the company beats the forecast of analysts with its report on May comparable-store sales. For the year, total sales are up 5.9% with comparable stores adding 5.1% from last year's haul. In another positive development for the company, credit card delinquency rates continue to fall lower.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:31 AM
  • JOY

    More on Joy Global's (NYSE:JOY) FQ2 results: EPS came in above estimates, but cuts fiscal-year...

    More on Joy Global's (NYSE:JOY) FQ2 results: EPS came in above estimates, but cuts fiscal-year outlook, citing a moderating order rate. EPS forecast at $7.15-$7.45 vs. $7.64 consensus; revenues $5.5B-$5.7B vs. $5.7B consensus. "With the U.S. market correcting quickly, and the international markets showing signs of near term slowing, we are turning our focus to trimming costs." JOY -2.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:25 AM
  • TLB

    Talbots (NYSE:TLB) agrees to be acquired by Sycamore Partners for $2.75 a share. TLB +102.3%...

    Talbots (NYSE:TLB) agrees to be acquired by Sycamore Partners for $2.75 a share. TLB +102.3% premarket to $2.61. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 AM
  • TGT

    Target (NYSE:TGT) same-store sales: +4.4% beats consensus of +3.5%. Shares +1.6% premarket. (PR)

    Target (NYSE:TGT) same-store sales: +4.4% beats consensus of +3.5%. Shares +1.6% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:13 AM
